initialTrustScoreEventScoreList.definition: Calculated from the KYC identification data (very thin data)
initialTrustScoreEventScoreList.name: KYC

initialTrustScoreEventScoreList.definition: Main questionnaire, not mandatory, but important for arbitrators (no way to have high enough TS from the beginning without it)
initialTrustScoreEventScoreList.name: GeneralQuestionnaire

transactionEventScoreList.valueAdjusting: Maximum contribution is 15, 80% of max contribution corresponds to 10,000 Txs permonth orN0.8 = 10,000 or rxN0.8 = 400 for day-by day
transactionEventScoreList.issue: When the day changes? It should be different for different locations?
transactionEventScoreList.name: TransactionFrequency

transactionEventScoreList.valueAdjusting: Maximum contribution is 15, 80% of max contribution corresponds to 100,000 COTI permonth orT0.8 = 100,000 or rxT0.8 = 4,000 for day-by day calculation
transactionEventScoreList.issue: When the day changes? It should be different for different locations?
transactionEventScoreList.name: Turnover

transactionEventScoreList.valueAdjusting: Maximum contribution is 15, 80% of max contribution corresponds to 10,000 COTI avgbalance in month or B0.8 = 10,000 or rxB0.8 = 400 for day-by day calculation
newaddress: Calculate TSbal_new_a[0:29] for the new address starting from the current balance backward
New address is unknown before address which is first time debited
There can be several TSbal_new_a within a day
transactionEventScoreList.movingSum: sum(exp(-decay*i) * nonlinearFunction(TSbal[i] + sum(TSbal_new_a[i] for all new addresses)) for  all stored days)
dayShift: TSbal[i+1] = TSbal[i] * exp(-decay) for i in 1:28
TSbal[1] = (TSbal[0] + sum(TSbal_new_a[0] for all new addresses) )* exp(-decay)
TSbal[0] = sum(Today balance for all addresses)
transactionEventScoreList.issue: When the day changes? It should be different for different locations?
transactionEventScoreList.name: AverageBalance

baseEventScoreList.idea: It is to be defined, how to catch it
algorithm: Go through all events, apply weight and decay and summarize
After a limitation term, move events from actual table to archive
baseEventScoreList.issue: When the day changes? It should be different for different locations?
baseEventScoreList.name: IncorrectTransaction

baseEventScoreList.idea: It is to be defined, how to catch it
algorithm: Go through all events, apply weight and decay and summarize
After a limitation term, move events from actual table to archive
baseEventScoreList.issue: When the day changes? It should be different for different locations?
baseEventScoreList.name: DoubleSpending

baseEventScoreList.idea: A person filling questionnaire too frequent is probably cheating
baseEventScoreList.algorithm: Apply penalty if there are 3 events per current day, double if 6, triple if 9
baseEventScoreList.name: FillingTheQuestionnaire

compensableEventScore.idea: Deposited money should increase TS for the depositor
compensableEventScore.valueAdjusting: Maximum contribution is 15 80% of max contribution corresponds to 1,000 deposited COTI
compensableEventScore.algorithm: Go through all DepositedBalance and ClosedDeposits events and summarize. D=sum(amounts)
compensableEventScore.comment: The algorithm will be changed to take into account how long deposits are kept and decay for old ones
compensableEventScore.name: DepositedBalance

compensableEventScore.idea: Not fulfilling a jury decision to pay or settle in other way
compensableEventScore.algorithm: Go through all NonFulfillment and LateFulfillment events, apply weights and summarize related
compensableEventScore.name: NonFulfillment

compensatingEventScore.idea: It is event of returning a deposit in all or in part, all description is in the parent event DepositedBalance
compensatingEventScore.name: ClosedDeposits

compensatingEventScore.idea: Fulfilling a jury decision after compensated TS in part
compensatingEventScore.calculation: TSnfcompensation = weight1 + weight2*sum(amount for the same parent)/10^6
compensatingEventScore.name: LateFulfillment

behaviorHighFrequencyEventsScore.comment: It is not always real high frequency, but the processing for these events is frequency-based

highFrequencyEventsScoreList.idea: A person sending too much claims to the arbitration should be deprived
highFrequencyEventsScoreList.algorithm: Count the number of claims for the last month, after apply nonlinear function, after add the stored value
highFrequencyEventsScoreList.name: Claim
